tool.name: Panaroo
tool.description: Generate core gene alignments from GFF3 files in a pangenome analysis.

param.name: input1
param.label: Select gff inputs to Panaroo
param.help: Select the files you wish to analyze with Panaroo, must be in gff3 format.

param.name: mode
param.label: filtering mode
param.help: Change a number of defaults to either favour strict, moderate or sensitive filtering

param.name: remove_invalid_genes
param.label: Remove Invalid Genes
param.help: Removes annotations that do not conform to the expected Prokka format. Disabled by default.

param.name: alignment
param.label: Alignment
param.help: Run MSA either for the core genome or for every gene cluster.

param.name: aligner
param.label: Alignment method
param.help: Choose an aligner from either PRANK, Clustal or the default, MAFFT.

param.name: core_threshold
param.label: Core gene threshold
param.help: Set the frequency of a gene in the your sample required to classify it as 'core'.

param.name: threshold
param.label: Initial Clustering Threshold
param.help: Set the threshold for gene clustering. Default is 0.98.

param.name: len_dif_percent
param.label: Length Difference Percent
param.help: Set the length difference percent for initial gene clustering. Default is 0.98.

param.name: family_identity
param.label: Family Sequence Identity Level
param.help: Set the level at which Panaroo collapses genes into putative families. Default is 0.7.

param.name: family_len_dif_percent
param.label: Family Len Dif Percent
param.help: Set the length difference cutoff at the gene family level. Default is 0.0.

param.name: merge_paralogs
param.label: Merge Paralogs
param.help: Merging paralogs can be enabled. Disabled by default.

param.name: search_radius
param.label: Refinding Search Radius
param.help: Set radius for the search in nucleotides for refinding genes. Default is 5000.

param.name: refind_prop_match
param.label: Refinding Proportion Match
param.help: Set the proportion of the missing gene to consider as a match for refinding. Default is 0.5.

param.name: refind_mode
param.label: Refind Mode
param.help: Set the stringency mode at which to re-find genes.

param.name: min_trailing_support
param.label: Min Trailing Support
param.help: Minimum cluster size to keep a gene called at the end of a contig.

param.name: trailing_recursive
param.label: Trailing Recursive
param.help: Number of times to perform recursive trimming of low support nodes near the end of contigs

param.name: edge_support_threshold
param.label: Edge Support Threshold
param.help: Minimum support required to keep an edge that has been flagged as a possible mis-assembly.

param.name: length_outlier_support_proportion
param.label: Length Outlier Support Proportion
param.help: Proportion of genomes supporting a gene with a length more than 1.5x outside the interquatile range for genes in the same cluster. Default is 0.01.

param.name: remove_by_consensus
param.label: Remove By Consensus
param.help: If a gene is called in the same region with similar sequence a minority of the time, remove it.

param.name: high_var_flag
param.label: High Var Flag
param.help: Minimum number of nested cycles to call a highly variable gene region. Default is 5.

param.name: min_edge_support_sv
param.label: Min Edge Support SV
param.help: Minimum edge support required to call structural variants in the presence/absence sv file

param.name: all_seq_in_graph
param.label: All Seq in Graph
param.help: Retains all DNA sequence for each gene cluster in the graph output. Off by Default.

param.name: no_clean_edges
param.label: No Clean Edges
param.help: Turn off edge filtering in the final output graph.

tool.help:
**Panaroo**
Panaroo is a pangenome analysis tool specifically designed to analyze bacterial genomes. Its main goal is to create accurate pangenomes by identifying and grouping genes that are shared or unique across multiple genomes within a species. Panaroo is built to overcome some of the challenges in pangenome analysis, especially issues with paralogs (genes that arise by duplication within the same genome) and annotation inconsistencies between different genome assemblies.
